dt: {bc}to get rid of as {d_link|superfluous|superfluous} or encumbering {bc}omit or forgo as part of a plan or as the result of some other decision

dt.t: must be prepared to {wi}jettison{/wi} many romantic notions

dt: {bc}to drop (cargo) to lighten a ship's load in time of distress
{bc}to drop from an aircraft or spacecraft in flight

shortdef: to get rid of as superfluous or encumbering : omit or forgo as part of a plan or as the result of some other decision
to drop (cargo) to lighten a ship's load in time of distress
to drop from an aircraft or spacecraft in flight

dt: {bc}a voluntary sacrifice of cargo to lighten a ship's load in time of distress

et: Middle English {it}jetteson{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}geteson{/it}, literally, action of throwing, from Latin {it}jactation-, jactatio{/it}, from {it}jactare{/it} {ma}{mat|jet|}{/ma}
shortdef: a voluntary sacrifice of cargo to lighten a ship's load in time of distress
